poem:
"Footnotes from the Caveman Runner"

Footfalls echo in minimalist beat,
Heel to ball in rhythm complete,
Chasing the phantom of the primal fleet.
Shoes, less ox-moronic, more bare-sweet,
Evolution's odd, yet natural feat.
Where Neanderthals and Nikes meet,
On streets paved in obsolete,
An echo, in its repeat,
Of a caveman, chasing past – barefeet.
